page.description: Converts a date string to an RFC 822 formatted date (Day, dd Month yy hh:mm:ss TIMEZONE)

prototypes.prototype: Formatted_Date_Time as C = A5_RFC822DATE( Character_Date_Time as C )
Formatted_Date_Time as C = A5_RFC822DATE( Time_Date as T )

argument.name: Formatted_Date_Time
argument.description: A date time value in the format: "Day, dd Mon yy hh:mm:ss GMT " ("Tue, 30 Mar 04 14:17:02 GMT")

argument.name: Character_Date_Time
argument.description: A date time value formatted "mm/dd/yyyy 0h:0m:0s am".

page.discussion: The A5_RFC822DATE() function takes a date, either as a time or character, and converts it to a string following the RFC 822 format.
page.example: dim t as T t = now() ?a5_rfc822date(t) = "Tue, 30 Mar 04 16:17:55 GMT"
